reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A young man’s quest to avenge his family’s murder and find his lost sister
reviews.reviewText: Sixteen year old Matt Darcy escaped his home with his little sister Lana when Barnaby Lincoln and his murderous outlaw family attacked and killed the rest of the Darcy family in an attempt to drive them off their homestead. Vowing vengeance, Matt settles his sister lost in an orphanage and goes to find the Lincolns. When she is adopted, he adds finding her to his “list”. He teams up with two other men who also have a score to settle with the Lincolns, and the three set off to find and kill them. The story has some plot twists, especially at the end but is well written, flows well and is a captivating read. This story is a slight departure from the author’s usual stories, there are no religious references or romance. You may find the ending controversial, but it is historically accurate: justice was dealt out in a way that was consistent with how things were handles back then.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Westfield always pleases
reviews.reviewText: This story caught my interest right away. Pace was good as were the characters. It seemed a bit too long which explains the 4 stars..otherwise a good read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I loved the compassionate camaraderie of the guys set on justice being served!
reviews.reviewText: Have to give five stars to this compassionately motivated series of one exciting episode after the other! Mike, Ross, and crew, puts 110% in their pursuit of the bad guys, who ravaged the land without too much interference from local law enforcement intervention!Once again, Mr. Westfield's outstanding storylines will definitely keep his readers turning pages, with one heroic adventure after the other! Too, the descriptive character selections were unsurpassed in their respective assignments, cover to cover!Definitely recommend this ongoing excitement that will pacify any old western fanatics desired expectations, as the goid guys go above and beyond in their pursuit of those responsible for their lawless endeavors! Even you nonwestern readers will find yourselves turning paged to see what occurs next!!!😃

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Matt and his sister Lana are the only survivors of a house fire set by an outlaw family. Matt is only sixteen and leaves his sister at an orphanage to try and get revenge. When he goes back he is told his sister was adopted. Matt follows the bad guys for 5 years and meet up with some other people that also are after the outlaws. Things happen to fix the trouble and bring the bad guys to justice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Loved Matt the main character and his developmentI had a wonderful ending.Made me think of riding again some day.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great story
reviews.reviewText: This was a wonderful story that was well written about historical western with an interesting storyline and characters. I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Ethan Westfield writes the way I like to read...

reviews.reviewTitle: Justice for wrongs committed, a search for his lost sister
reviews.reviewText: Matthew Darcy’s life was shattered when Barnaby Lincoln mercilessly destroyed his family. He is driven by a thirst for justice. Ross Sessions is a marshal and decides to help Matthew in his quest against the Lincolns. And he wants to find his lost sister who disappeared from the orphanage where he had left her for a short time.
